text: Welcome to the first session of #NGSSchat!  With the release of the #NGSS tomorrow, we'll use tonight to focus on some prep.
Our focus will be the 3 pillars of the K12 Framework and their implications.  Please remember to use #NGSSchat in your tweets.
Having knowledge of the key dimensions of the Framework will be very helpful tonight, as weâ€™ll be referencing quite a bit.  #NGSSchat
It will be good to have the Framework open in front of you a shortened version can be found here (via @NSTA): http://learningcenter.nsta.org/files/PB326X.pdfÂ â€_ #NGSSchat
Weâ€™ll be using a Q/A format. Before we start, please introduce yourself/what you do/where youâ€™re from. #NGSSchat
Adam Percival, from Austin Texas. I develop K-12 educational science software. #NGSSchat
Fred Ende, Metro NYC, Regional Science Coordinator. #NGSSchat
Small group, huh?  Well, welcome, Adam. :) #ngsschat
Jen Arnswald, education consultant Kent ISD- Grand Rapids, Michigan #ngsschat
We'll start with the Scientific Practices. . .#ngsschat
Hey Jen.  Welcome. :) #ngsschat
Make that 3 #ngsschat
Q1.  Science Practices are meant to help educators move away from 1 "scientific method." How do you see this changing instruction? #NGSSchat
@FredEnde @JenArnswald Familiar folks! Good to "see" you both :). #NGSSchat
Chuck - Asst Principal from Atlanta lurking :) #NGSSchat
Q1: I'm pretty excited... "inquiry" alone is just a small part of what real science is about. #NGSSchat
I especially like practices 5-8 for this reason... really sounds out science ed. in my opinion. #NGSSchat
Hi Chuck.  Welcome.  Feel free to lurk as much as you like :) #ngsschat
@charleswgardner Welcome Chuck! #NGSSchat
Specifically, I think there is a shift toward taking the results of inquiry and "doing" something with them. #NGSSchat
It's great that Framework looks to shift away from "inquiry" being a vague idea to being a set of "doable" practices. #ngsschat
Constructing explanations, communicating results, etc. #NGSSchat
@ampercival. . .Agreed.  Will allow for a true move from "process skills" to "mult. use practices" #ngsschat
My pet peeve is also that "inquiry" can turn into activity-based instruction without rigorous thinking behind it. #NGSSchat
"Inquiry" has become an #educational buzzword.  Too vague, too many different def.  Clearly defined practices should help! #ngsschat
Q2.  Of the 8 practices we anticipate seeing, which do you think have the great implication for your work? Why?  #ngsschat
@fredende Agree... I hope the keywords in the framework don't head in that direction :) "Buzzwordification" is all too common. #NGSSchat
I'm very excited for engaging in #argument.  We need to move away from the "answer and move on" process.   #ngsschat
Q2: For me I'd say it's #1 and #6... because engineering hasn't been a nationwide focus for K-12 until now. #NGSSchat
Big shift: observations aren't the key, synthesizing from them becomes the focus and the key to the process. #ngsschat
RT @arosey: Big shift: observations arent the key, synthesizing from them becomes the focus and the key to the process. #ngsschat
@fredende Yeah, that's a key one for moving away from pure inquiry. #NGSSchat
Howdy @arosey.  Thanks for joining! #ngsschat
I agree w/ @FredEnde too often we have kids complete tasks but they never process the meaning of what they are doing #ngsschat
@arosey. . .Think it will be a big change for many to get away from facts for facts sake. #ngsschat
@JenArnswald Will also require folks to "slow down" when exploring ideas.  Solid argument requires lots of thought time. #ngsschat
I think #modeling is a big of a shift too.  I know we never really worked with models as much as we should have.  Others model? #ngsschat
RT @arosey: Integrating engineering practices into K-12. Feel like biggest challenge (for me) will be elementary ed. #NGSSchat
@FredEnde @bydlowski #7 right now. We r doing a workshop Monday with our ela folks on argumentation and writing #ngsschat
@ampercival @arosey. . .What does #elemsci look like for you currently? #ngsschat
@fredende I will definitely focus more on #modeling now... I've seen some argue that #2 should be the "main" practice. #NGSSchat
@bydlowski. . .Thanks for coming by. :)  #ngsschat
@ampercival Certainly the biggest shift. . .for me, anyway. #ngsschat
Let's shift over to the cross - cutting concepts. . . . #ngsschat
@fredende I've actually worked very little on #elemsci so far... unfortunately for K-5 most districts put sci on back burner #NGSSchat
Q3. Cross-Cutting Concepts are meant to help eds bridge divide between sci. and other disciplines. How do you see them being used? #ngsschat
@ampercival Agreed.  Districts will really need to focus in on K-5/6 #sci #edu for #learning progressions to work. #ngsschat
@arosey @ampercival It's tough.  #ELA and #math are a hyper-focus at #elem level. #ngsschat
@fredende Interesting... hadn't heard that. Do you mean bridge disciplines w/in science? #NGSSchat
Have to had a chance to look at the 8+1 model from MSU- totally reorganizes the way science is taught #ngsschat
@fredende Getting science a major role in K-5 may be the biggest barrier to the success of #NGSS in my opinion. #NGSSchat
@ampercival Within and from content area to content area.  Supposed to help address challenges of relevancy and "connectedness" #ngsschat
@JenArnswald No.  How does it "work?" #ngsschat
@jenarnswald No... do you like how they are arranging things? I thought the timing was odd, coming out @ same time as #NGSS #NGSSchat
@fredende OK- I can see that... for example, cause and effect in ELA, patterns, scale in Math. Interesting! #NGSSchat
I think Cross-Cutting Concepts have the potential to allow #teachers to do some truly "interdisciplinary" work.  #ngsschat
@FredEnde @ampercival Crosscut will support CommonCore, lets ELA/Math support us. Hope to use crosscutters to frame school wide PD #ngsschat
For instance. . .patterns.  #Sci. #teacher explores pred/prey in class and work w/SS #teacher to explore pop. density. #ngsschat
They researched the 8 major themes from science- very similar to the crosscutting con. Pruitt says the two will go hand in hand  #ngsschat
They researched the 8 major themes from science- very similar to the crosscutting con. Pruitt says the two will go hand in hand  #ngsschat
@arosey That's one place where #NGSS can strengthen #science #instruction at #elementary level!  Have you started planning PD yet? #ngsschat
@arosey That's one place where #NGSS can strengthen #science #instruction at #elementary level!  Have you started planning PD yet? #ngsschat
CCC #5 seems a bit odd in this light- that is one that seems very narrowly "science focused" #NGSSchat
RT @fredende: I think Cross-Cutting Concepts have the potential to allow #teachers to do some truly "interdisciplinary" work.  #ngsschat
@ampercival Agree.  #Flows and #cycles have connections elsewhere, but the #energy and #matter seems to confine its use. #ngsschat
Love #structure and #function and #stability and #change.  Can envision lots of #connections there.  #ngsschat
What about using the CCC's to connect diff. #science #disciplines?  Examples? #ngsschat
I've actually thought a lot about different thematic units, each built around a CCC- could be really interesting #NGSSchat
Great!  Let's jump over to the Disciplinary Core Ideas (DCI). . . . #ngsschat
So ex: systems- cells, organs, organ systems, states of matter- open/closed systems, solar system, earth system #NGSSchat
Not sure how well it'd work in practice, but interesting idea to play with. #NGSSchat
@FredEnde I think that other states will definitely be watching.  There are some school in Ohio using 8+1 http://8plus1science.org/Â  #ngsschat
YES! RT @ampercival: ex: systems- cells, organs, organ systems, states of matter- open/closed systems, solar system, earth system #ngsschat
Q4. An emphasis of #NGSS is on more depth/less breadth. What intrigues/frightens you about the proposed LS, PS, ESS Core Ideas?  #ngsschat
@JenArnswald Just took a quick look at the site.  Think it is a great organizer.  Hope it makes its way to more states! #ngsschat
Core Ideas can be found on page six of the Reader's Guide found here: http://learningcenter.nsta.org/files/PB326X.pdfÂ â€_ #ngsschat
From the less breadth standpoint, I'm still not sold on the engineering components. #NGSSchat
Concerned that chem and physics teachers won't think there is enough content #ngsschat
Very excited to see LS4 (#evolution) so prominent, a little unsure of PS4 (#waves and tech implications). #ngsschat
@KKleespies Welcome!  Glad to have you! #ngsschat
@ampercival That's going to be a tough one.  From the way DCI's are written, seems very broad to me. . . #ngsschat
@kkleespies Welcome! #NGSSchat
Agree! RT @fredende: Very excited to see LS4 (#evolution) so prominent, a little unsure of PS4 (#waves and tech implications). #ngsschat
@fredende Waves is a weak spot... that's an artificial distinction from "energy" to me, which goes right before it. #NGSSchat
@JenArnswald Definitely a big emphasis on #life #science.  But, #physical #science topics are definitely big ideas. #ngsschat
@jenarnswald Yes there is surprisingly little- at HS level I think you have to go "above and beyond" the framework for phys/chem. #NGSSchat
Question: What does LS1.D-- information processing refer to?  #NGSSchat
@ampercival Actually like the group dynamic thread (LS2D).  Think it provides lots of tie-ins.   #ngsschat
@ampercival Not sure about info processing though.  Anyone know what the blurb from the Framework was referring to there? #ngsschat
@KKleespies LS = Life Science 1, 1 = Core Idea 1 (Molecules to Organisms), d = Subidea (Info Processing) #ngsschat
@ampercival but is that really the true intention of the standards? #ngsschat
@KKleespies Here's a Reader's Guide that explains (head to page six): http://learningcenter.nsta.org/files/PB326X.pdfÂ â€_ #ngsschat
@fredende Waves is a weak spot... that's an artificial distinction from "energy" to me, which goes right before it. #NGSSchat
LS1.D- desc. is: how do organisms detect, process and use info about the environment?  #NGSSchat
Final Q: Big focus is on greater inclusion of engineering. How much eng./design is done in your school?  Ideas for doing more?  #ngsschat
Focus is senses, neuroprocessing, animal behavior, tropisms in plants, memory/perception- bit of a "grab bag" #NGSSchat
@jenarnswald Supposedly they are what "all" students need to know, so maybe theory is all students don't take phys/chem? #NGSSchat
@FredEnde Science and TechEd are well established. My goal is to find bridges to address engineering/design #ngsschat
@ampercival Hmm. . . .That's a big, big, idea. :) #ngsschat
@arosey A lofty goal.  Any bridges currently being built? #ngsschat
Core Ideas can be found on page six of the Reader's Guide found here: http://learningcenter.nsta.org/files/PB326X.pdfÂ â€_ #ngsschat
@FredEnde Just conversations to start. Depts. currently on their own islands. Some good ideas how to crossover via physics & chem #ngsschat
@grangermdk Howdy, Michael! #ngsschat
Was just looking at @NSTA 's "Everyday Engineering"- looks like some cool ideas there. #NGSSchat
@arosey Finding ways to connect those islands is always the most challenging.  Have tech. departments been following #NGSS? #ngsschat
Was just looking at @NSTA 's "Everyday Engineering"- looks like some cool ideas there. #NGSSchat
@ampercival perhaps states will group them as an intro phy sci course. We need 2 decided if the standards r enough 4 college bound #ngsschat
@JenArnswald Good point.  Imagine much data collection will need to take place there. #ngsschat
@jenarnswald For sure! My gut is they may not be... however, maybe stu. with greater depth of understanding will be as prepared #NGSSchat
That's a wrap, all. Thx for the great discussion.  I feel primed and ready to start reviewing the draft #NGSS tomorrow!  #ngsschat
@jenarnswald intro phys sci wouldn't surprise me... that's fairly common nation wide. #NGSSchat
@ampercival Have heard good things about Eng is Elemntary http://www.mos.org/eie/Â  #ngsschat
Will make archive available ASAP. . .Please join us next week as we delve into the draft standards!  #SameTime #SameHashtag  #ngsschat
@fredende Thank you! Likewise, very excited to take a look! #ngss #NGSSchat
@arosey Thanks for the recommendation! #NGSSchat
@ampercival NGSS writer told me that if students came to him thinking the NGSS way it wouldn't matter how much content they knew #ngsschat
Happy NGSS day tomorrow! #ngsschat
@ampercival @arosey @JenArnswald @charleswgardner @KKleespies @bydlowski @grangermdk Thanks for chatting! #ngsschat
Happy NGSS day tomorrow! #ngsschat
@jenarnswald Makes sense... if you truly understand the #NGSS basics the rest would come pretty easily. #NGSSchat

visual matrix looks great - colors & spatial (columns,...) w popups & links - and organizes (lots of) info! http://www.nextgenscience.org/msets-ed-engineering-designÂ â€_ #ngsschat

Q2.  #NGSS was drafted with #elemsci PIs written by grade level rather than by band (i.e. K-2, 3-5).  Good idea?  Bad idea?  Why?  #NGSSchat

I thought I tweeted a few minutes ago, saying "please check your email" but maybe I didn't? #ngsschat
Any other takers for a chat?  Lots of good questions :) #NGSSchat
@CraigRusbult @FredEnde - NGSS chat tough for me to attend. Started grad classes Wednesday nights. Appreciate your goals though. #ngsschat
@FredEnde, talk Design Process? sure -- last week you said a goal is to "move from 'scientific method'" why? (stereotyped SM?) #ngsschat
@MrMusselman @CraigRusbult Hi Sean. No worries. We'll shift back to Thurs. next week and mix Q's up.  Hopefully better turnout. :) #NGSSChat
Haven't had an opportunity to digest the draft yet. Lots to untangle and understand with the interconnected strands. #ngsschat
@CraigRusbult Writers felt that SM was too "process" oriented; skills not "transferable" enough. That's why focus on "practices." #NGSSchat

Many different looks to the "design process." Is this a pos or neg for science instruction? See for yourself: http://bit.ly/KQPCmzÂ  #NGSSchat

@FredEnde kids use design for all they do! (so w DProcess transfer is a strong point) build bridges from life to design to sci... #ngsschat

@FredEnde Sorry...I haven't had time to delve into the #NGSS but plan to this weekend. When is next #NGSSchat?

#NGSSchat Amy from Alabama-here to chat!
Hey Amy!  Glad you're joining us!   #NGSSChat
A1: I am glad to see the connections to other topics, grades and the #CCSS. Some PE's easy to follow, others not so much. #NGSSchat
Q1: Personally I liked the layout, but I know that the amount of info threw off some. Could be simplified with just PEs and links  #NGSSChat
Liked connections as well.  Thought that was a strong point.  Any PEs that stick out as particularly easy/challenging? #NGSSChat
@yanksmitch I can see where some teachers could think PE's were to complex. #NGSSchat
@yanksmitch Agree.  Saw lots of feedback saying "Too Much Info."  PEs and links, remove foundation boxes? #NGSSChat
A1: As in specific PEs? or whole topics? #NGSSChat
@yanksmitch Let's start with a few specific PEs that stick out as being either very well done, or quite poor. #NGSSChat
@amykfmurphy Did like how they were using the web with the hover details, so that the doc can be modified for reading diff ways #NGSSChat
@yanksmitch Liked that too.  Though I heard a lot of griping, I must say I also enjoyed color on/off option. #NGSSChat
I focused on PS.SPM strand-was unclear on a) Construct models showing that stable forms of matter #NGSSchat (1/2)
A1: Most PEs were easy to follow, espec with clarification statements. My issues are with how the PEs relate to each other #NGSSChat
Q2.  #NGSS was drafted with #elemsci PEs written by grade level rather than by band (i.e. K-2, 3-5).  Good idea?  Bad idea?  Why?  #NGSSChat
#NGSSchat (2/2) are those with minimum magnetic and electrical field energy. Perhaps confused because I focus on stabilty of electrons...
@yanksmitch Yep.  There were some points where I said to myself, "Wait, didn't we just do this?" or "Why is this here?" #NGSSChat
@yanksmitch That was a nice feature. #NGSSchat
@amykfmurphy I'm following.  Could certainly see potential issues there. #NGSSChat
A2: PEs for #elemsci prob be better in bands, but I teach HS, so I'm not the expert there. #NGSSchat
A2: For MS and HS they are banded, and "model pathways" will be given. Why not do the same for ES? ... #NGSSChat
A2: Specific grade level PEs make adoption much harder, and I don't think it's necessary to be so prescriptive. #NGSSChat
@amykfmurphy One of my responsibilities is to direct a K-6 science curriculum.  Lack of banding is def. a problem. #NGSSChat
@yanksmitch Agreed.  Can't figure it out.  Seems logical to provide choice and flexibility.  Why make #NGSS lockstep? #NGSSChat
@FredEnde and clarification statement for that #NGSS didn't clarify issue. Noted stable noble gases, ionic substances... #NGSSchat
On the flip side, specific grade level PEs will make commercial programs easier to create- maybe pandering to that? #NGSSChat
@amykfmurphy Clarification statements were great. . . until they weren't :) #NGSSChat
@FredEnde Also don't agree with where some topics were stuck. For example, weather and prop of matter in Kg #NGSSChat
@yanksmitch Hope not.  But seems possible.  #Elemsci programs are big $$$$ #NGSSChat
Hi sorry I'm late, Dan sci coordinator nj, I'm gonna stalk this a bit as Im lil unprepared been 2busy2 really sit w Ngss  #Ngsschat
@yanksmitch Absolutely.  Banding would ease that fact.  Seems like Grade K would benefit from other explorations. #NGSSChat
@dandanscienc Hey Dan!  Lurk away.  We're talking #elemsci PEs and throwing in a bit of other items too!  Join as you see fit! #NGSSChat
@FredEnde @yanksmitch I am curious why they switched from banding in NSES to grade specific in #NGSS. #NGSSchat

Awesome! Thnx! Will do!

Going to go check out #patue #ngsschat
Hey Ryan. Today's topic was #elemsci PEs.  Ran a review session in my region this evening, so sharing that with anyone interested. #NGSSchat
Once groups were comfortable they started to look at groups of PEs within a standard.   #NGSSchat
We then explored progressions of DCIs, practices, and CCCs.  We finished by exploring relevance and appropriateness of eng. #NGSSchat
Here's some feedback from the session. . . #NGSSchat
Participants found the appendices helpful in regard to progressions.  Many really enjoyed Appendix F. #NGSSchat
Concerns with J (course models): HS-PS1-d didn't seem to exist despite being listed; HS-PS1-g was included in physics, but why? #NGSSchat
Appendix J concerns, cont.: no PS2-C for HS, but listed in Physics course and Chemistry.  HS Ts were shaking their heads. #NGSSchat
Concern for #nyed and other states too: How can curric. be designed w/o assessment blueprint? #NGSSchat
For #elemsci, concerns about specificity and clarity, particularly around terms, and issues with progress v. mastery of practices. #NGSSchat
Finally, discussion about conflicts between #nyed #CommonCore texts and #NGSS grade level standards at elementary.   #NGSSchat
This is a major "uh oh" moment for #nyed as literature themes are at odds w/grade level standards.  This will make it harder (1/2) #NGSSchat
for Ts to meld ELA and science, which was part of the plan.  Other states may have this issue too. (2/2) #NGSSchat
Overall view: Ts, admins, and curric. writers liked the general goals and loved the PEs philosophically.   #NGSSchat
#NYED actions will impact whether that love translates into enjoying the implementation process as well.  Time will tell. #NGSSchat
Specific PE feedback too, but that was major piece.  Ts, admins, and curric. writers were so glad to have had the session. #NGSSchat
I encourage all to engage in this type of regional meeting.  Asst. Supts. said they couldn't believe how animated discussion (1/2) #NGSSchat
Overall view: Ts, admins, and curric. writers liked the general goals and loved the PEs philosophically.   #NGSSchat
was at 6:00 in evening. :)  So worth it.  Could have gone for longer, but had to get home to host #NGSSchat :) #NGSSchat

Q1  One element of #NGSS vision is coherent approach to science, K12.  Share successes or barriers to achieving this vision. #NGSSchat
A1 for me, one large barrier is moving too fast. "I'm already NGSS aligned" unnerves me. I'd like to be more reflective. #NGSSchat
A1 barriers include lack of understanding of rigor in sci Ed- many Ts struggle w/ teaching concepts #ngsschat
A1: pro-all grades taught.  coding in written stds. Con-lack of science Ed prep in preservice at lower level.  #NGSSchat
A1: Success #1 As a new teacher, #NGSS is mostly unpacked for me, and I can actually understand them. #NGSSchat
A1 - we have 5+ sender schools which feed into our high school district which can pose challenges with vertical alignment #NGSSchat
